alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 409 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Three Rivers, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruidoso, Bonito Lake, Alto, Nogal, and Oscuro. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 73 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: South Central Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley
